name: A(n Almost) Perfect Game #3: Rocks in Space
name_original: A(n Almost) Perfect Game #3: Rocks in Space
description:
The Perfect Game Project rests on the assumption that it's a pleasure to watch someone else play a video game really, really well.  And what better player than AI that already knows where the points are coming from and how?  Download the game, stick it in the corner of your desktop, and watch the computer play perfectly as the score goes up and up.  Is one million points enough?  Maybe two?  Only you can be certain.

Controls:  None!

Sound:  None!

Rocks in Space, Perfect Game Project #3, is an Asteroids-style game where the ship is pretty good at blasting the space rocks into dust.  However, questioning the premise of the Perfect Game Project a bit, these ships aren't perfect; they will all, at some point, collide with an asteroid and explode.  Perhaps it's more entertaining to root for something you know will eventually fail than for something you know will always achieve perfection?
